result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett A Beckwith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking - Intent. Gain Access to Record, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(c).
  • Stalking - Intent. Gain Access to Record, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(c).
  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).
  • Stalking - Intent. Gain Access to Record, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(c).
  • Stalking - Intent. Gain Access to Record, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KM, ZA, KG or CB or any of their family members or employers.  Def may not use computer, smart phone or any electronic device that has applications such as Tinder, Snapchat or Facebook or that has access to the internet.
2/3/2021 CT orders JOC to be amended f/w to reflect modification of one condition of probation as req by DOC (see documents 22 & 24):  DE may not use any computer, smart phone or electronic device w/ social media applications/websites unless previously authorized by his agent.

Crt authorizes release of PSI for Sex Offender Treatment. Def forfeits any computer or phones seized by Stoughton PD during this investigation and will be destroyed. Sex Offender Registry Required for 15 yrs following initial confinement. Def to complete sex offender treatment and counseling.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with K.R.G., C.T.B., Z.A., or K.M.M.
- Defendant shall not access the internet except for the purposes of employment, seeking employment, or communicating with his attorney.
- Defendant shall not use any social media applications or access any social media sites.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 15

Defendant in court with Attorney Adam Walsh.  Joshua M. Bowland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
